thread.title: Watch 52-Year-Old Barry Bonds Prove He's Still the Home Run King
thread.title_full: Watch 52-Year-Old Barry Bonds Prove He's Still the Home Run King

author: Reegan von Wildenradt
title: Watch 52-Year-Old Barry Bonds Prove He's Still the Home Run King
text:
Privacy Policy | About Us 
Any guy over 50 years old who is still hitting homers with ease is pretty impressive, but it isn't a complete shock. Bonds retired from the sport at 42 years old and finished his last season with 28 homers. He holds a bunch of different MLB records, including most home runs in a single season (73) and the most career home runs (762). Not too shabby. 
So is the former MLB great prepping for a comeback? Probably not. Bonds still has a substantial amount of controversy following him around, mostly to do with his disputed use of performance-enhancing drugs. It's impossible to say whether or not Bonds is using steroids today. Either way, it's still pretty impressive that the former great is still mashing dingers 10 years after retirement.
